field.p: The delivery process is aimed at controlling, packaging and shipping of goods sold to the destination chosen by the customer, in the best conditions of time and costs.

field.p: Change Management Processes include a sequence of steps or activities that move a change from inception to delivery. Change Management Plans are developed to support a project to deliver a change. It is typically created during the planning stage of a Change Management Process

field.name: description
field.p: The accounting process is three separate types of transactions used to record business transactions in the accounting records. This information is then aggregated into financial statements. The transaction types are as follows:

ol.li: The first transaction type is to ensure that reversing entries from the previous period have, in fact, been reversed.
The second group is comprised of the steps needed to record individual business transactions in the accounting records.
The third group is the period-end processing required to close the books and produce financial statements.

field.p: IT management is the process of overseeing all matters related to information technology operations and resources within an IT organization. IT management ensures that all technology resources and associated employees are utilized properly and in a manner that provides value for the organization.

field.name: description
field.p: In short, financial management entails planning, organising, controlling, monitoring and evaluating the financial resources of an organisation to achieve its overall objectives.

field.p: This process aim at developing a document that formally authorizes the existence of the project and provides the Project Manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities.

The key benefit of this process is a well-defined project start and project boundaries, creation of a formal record of the project, and a direct way for senior management to formally accept and commit to the project.

field.p: This is a standard business document we receive from customers, whose purpose is to invite us into a bidding process to bid on specific products or services. RfQ generally means the same thing as Call for bids (CfB) and Invitation for bid (IfB)

field.name: description
field.p: This is a standard commercial document and first official offer issued by a buyer to us indicating types, quantities, and agreed prices for products or services

field.name: description
field.p: Standard commercial document send to a buyer listing in detail the services or goods that we sold to the customer.

field.p: The delivery note is a document that is given to the customer indicating the quantity and the nature of the goods received by him. It is established at least in 2 signed copies of the parties: the seller or the carrier and the recipient customer.

field.p: The sales journal is the prime entry book used in our accounting system to keep track of the sales of items that customers(debtors) have purchased on account by charging a receivable on the debit side of an accounts receivable account and crediting revenue on the credit side.

field.p: The project charter is the document issued by the project initiator or sponsor that formally authorizes the existence of the project and provides the Project Manager with the authority to apply organizational resources to project activities.

record.field: Political instability (risk of war, terrorism, local conflict, attacks ...)

field.name: description
field.p: Risk of loss of business or profitability outside the company's natural boundary, due to geopolitical instability in the area of presence.

field.name: cause
field.p: War, terrorism, local conflict, bombing.

ul.li: Issues related to the safety of people and property.
Loss of turnover and/or profitability.
Economic and financial losses.
Reputational risk; risk of business failure.

field.name: control
field.p: Monitor all geopolitical indicators available, from multiple sources (Ministries, Banks, International Institutions). Monitor local and regional situation, implement micromanagement on site.

field.name: action
field.p: In-depth knowledge of the country concerned and its associated risks. Mastering the geopolitical issues of the geographical area of exposure. Reduction of the presence, repositioning of critical processes, exit of the zone, Avoidance strategy, reduction strategy.

record.field: Unfavorable economic climate impacting the dynamics of the company's activity: inflation, slowdown, GDP decline, unemployment

field.name: description
field.p: Deteriorating economic conditions for carrying out business activities

ul.li: Economic crisis of local, regional, national or global impact;
unemployment, decline in purchasing power B2B or B2C;
deterioration of public accounts, over-indebtedness, economic failure of a branch of activity.
Loss of turnover, loss of business opportunities, loss of relative or absolute market shares.
Loss business development opportunity.
customer insolvency.

field.name: control
field.p: Growth rate of the turnover. Turnover rate of the offer. Failure rate on launching new offers. Fine management of the company's activity levels (production, storage and consumption cycles)

field.name: action
field.p: Adaptability and flexibility of the strategic and production model of the company: reactivity of the supply the evolution of the demand, adaptation of the structure of production and cost of the offer; risk reduction strategy to be favored.

record.field: Poor identification or poor definition of the strategic segments of the strategic business model

field.name: description
field.p: Incorrect determination of the strategic business model segments to which the commercial offer is deployed.

ul.li: Bad knowledge of the market.
Bad segmentation of customers / prospects database.
Mismatch between Commercial offers and market demand.
Inability to market the produced offers on the desired customer segments;
Loss of sales, deterioration of the company's economic conditions.

field.name: control
field.p: Success rate of the marketing of the offer by strategic segment. Number of strategic segments. Dimensioning and validated consistency of the strategic business model

field.name: action
field.p: Precise analysis of target market, anticipated segments, and customer profiles making up each strategic segment. Precise identification of the specific needs of each client and consistency of the offer that is intended for them. Risk circumvention or reduction strategy.

field.name: description
field.p: Inability of the company to meet its financial commitments, for lack of liquid cash.

ul.li: Poorly controlled need in working capital
Structural inadequacy of the upper part of the company's balance sheet
Lack of appropriate cash flow forecast
Significant delay in a customer payment
unavailability of suitable short-term financing solutions.

field.name: consequence
field.p: Unpaid bills, cash-flow difficulties, which may lead to a situation of cessation of payments leading to the opening of a bankruptcy or liquidation procedure.

field.name: control
field.p: Daily situation of the current cash position; cash flow forecasts; number of days and amounts of anticipated overruns; rate and degree of use of short-term financing schemes
